page.title: 18CHAPEL AREA 2
page.content: The landscape here is predominantly rural with open views across the level plateau from Quintrell Downs towards Newquay and the sea.New estates being built at the edge of this resort are gradually spreading towards Quintrell Downs:the one now being constucted by SNW (a St Austell firm) in the Tretherras area.Trencreek,previously a hamlet with it's own identity outside Newquay,is now almost engulfed by this new estate, and eventually the same could happen to Quintrell Downs. In the area the farmland consist mainly of grass with some cereals, but there are still a wide variety of wild flowers in the hedgerows. For instance, we found honeysuckle, foxgloves, buttercups and pink campions in the relatively unspoilt area around the hamlet of Chapel.
